features: 2-in-1 Design: Easily switch between smartphone and camera usage with the versatile 2-in-1 mobile phone clip design.
Portability: Weighing only 1.34lbs/0.61kg, it's lightweight and easy to carry, making it ideal for travel and outdoor photography.
Adjustable Height: Customize the height from 17 to 60 inches, adapting to various shooting needs and environments.
360° Panoramic Shooting: The 3-way pan head allows for smooth 360° horizontal rotation and adjustable tilt angles (+100°/-75°), enabling perfect panoramic shots.
Compact and Travel-Friendly: With a folded length of just 42cm, it easily fits into your bag, making it a convenient choice for travelers and photographers on the go.

1. How to choose the height of the tripod? Choose a tripod that is suitable for your height. Tripod height=your height-15cm-camera height. If you have additional requirements, you can choose according to the actual situation. 2. What is the difference between carbon fiber tripod and aluminum tripod? For the same size tripod,carbon fiber will weigh about 30% less than aluminum alloy, and its strength will be higher, and it will not rust. But the value is also higher. 3.How to choose the tripod loading capacity? You can choose according to the weight of camera and lens, for example your equipment is 2kg, it is suggested to choose the tripod bearing above 4kg. 4.What is the difference between the twist lock and the lever lock? The structure of the twist lock is simple, easy to replace parts, disassemble, clean and maintain. The lever lock opens faster and is easy to operate with one hand. 5. Can other gimbal be installed? Yes, any gimbal with a 3/8-inch port on the bottom is compatible.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Game-Changer for On-the-Go Video Assessments!
reviews.reviewText: My quest for a super lightweight and highly versatile tripod led me to the K&F CONCEPT B174A1 Travel Tripod with Bluetooth Remote for Camera Smartphone, and it has exceeded my expectations.Weighing just a little over 1 1/2 pounds, this aluminum and plastic tripod is exceptionally well constructed. Its compact design folds down to a mere 17 inches, making it incredibly easy to store in a vehicle or attach to a backpack for impromptu adventures. Unlocking the tripod legs allows for extension up to 60 inches, providing the perfect height for my video assessments.The head of the tripod is ingeniously designed, featuring an expandable compression spring clamp (4.3” to 6.8”) for smartphones and a cold shoe for conventional cameras. The 3-way directional axis pan head offers smooth 360° horizontal rotation and adjustable tilt angles, ensuring a full field of imagery.A thoughtful addition is the miniature dot-level on the upper surface, helping to ensure a leveled-out tripod for perfectly framed shots. The green circular level with a tiny bead is a small detail that makes a big difference.The product also includes a camera remote shutter control fob and a convenient soft carrying bag for storing the tripod and remote.While lightweight tripods inevitably come with trade-offs, such as potentially less stability in the field, this tripod performs admirably for most assignments. For added stability, I found solutions like an aftermarket center-mounted counterweight or a suspended sand/rock bag to be effective.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Basic tripod which works well for holding phones and smaller lights
reviews.reviewText: The tripod comes with a phone camera remote, a carrying bag, and basic instructions.The tripod is made from a lightweight but sturdy feeling plastic so a strong breeze could probably knock the tripod over but it would survive the fall. There is a circle level built into the base for making sure the tripod is level when you set it up. The legs are secured via friction when you open them and this as worked good for me so far. The legs do expand/shrink and have friction lever locks for securing them (two per leg).The tripod head does have pan, pitch, and angle locking screws. These allow you to point the tripod where you need it then lock it in place. Additionally, there is a mount screw and a built in camera holder which sits flat on the head.The camera holder works well for holding my Pixel Pro 7 in it's Spigen Tough Armor case. I find it easiest to put the edge of my phone into the top prong of the phone holder then push up to expand it and slip the phone in to secure it. My only issue with the built-in holder is you are not be able to angle your phone up or down as it holds the phone so that pushing the head up or down angles the phone left or right (see example picture). It would have been nice if there was a way to have the phone holder oriented so moving the head up and down would move the phone in the same direction.The remote says it works with iOS and Android phones, although some phones may require additional software. There is a link provided in the instructions to the necessary software, should you need it. The remote worked perfectly with the default camera app on my Pixel Pro 7 after I paired it through Bluetooth.The bag is a simple sling bag that feels like it's made out of think nylon. It feels sturdy enough for carrying the tripod, but feels like it would be easy to tear also. It fits the tripod easily and has a small slip bead for closing and securing the open end of the bag.Overall, I'm happy with tripod and remote. If you are looking for a basic and light tripod then you can't go wrong with this one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Super Lightweight Versatile Tripod
reviews.reviewText: I have been on the lookout for a super lightweight and highly versatile tripod to take with me at a moment’s notice for quick video assessments.That’s when I discovered this K&F CONCEPT B174A1 Travel Tripod with Bluetooth Remote for Camera Smartphone.Weighing in at just a little over 1 1/2 pounds, this aluminum and plastic tripod is very well constructed, and folds down to a length of just 17 inches for easy storage in a vehicle or lashed to a backpack. By unlocking the tripod legs, this product can be extended up to 60 inches in length.The head of the tripod is designed to either use an expandable compression spring clamp (4.3” to 6.8”) to hold your smartphone, or a cold shoe to accommodate a screw-on conventional camera. The 3-way directional axis pan head allows for smooth 360° horizontal rotation and adjustable tilt angles to capture a full field of imagery.A small but value-added detail is the inclusion of a miniature dot-level to help ensure that your tripod is leveled-out for perfectly framed shots. It’s a small green circular level with an even smaller bead within, and located on the upper surface of where the top portion of the tripod legs attach to the center shaft.Also Included in the product offering is a camera remote shutter control fob, as well as a nifty soft carrying bag to store the tripod and remote.A compact, lightweight tripod will inevitably have some trade offs, regardless of how well it is made, and that applies to this product as well. With lightweight tripods, the lack of weight means potentially less stability when shooting in the field. That can be overcome if needed by adding either an aftermarket center-mounted counterweight, or investing in a sand/rock bag to suspend beneath the tripod in a sort of hammock. But for the most part, lightweight compact tripods like this have their place and do quite well for most assignments.Overall, I have been very impressed with this K&F CONCEPT B174A1 Travel Tripod, and can recommend it to anyone needing a quality- built portable tripod that can perform double-duty for use of smartphones or conventional camera use.
Treppiede robusto ! Perfetto per chi come me è alle prime armi, leggero e robusto , sia per fotocamera che smartphone, proprio quello che cercavo

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: There are lots of tripods to choose from and to be honest this one is good but I don't have other tripods to compare it to. It has a premium feel to it and is easy to handle and set up. However, for me the reason this is 3 stars and not 4 or 5 is because I wanted to use it with my phone. Although the tripod has a phone holder, it is not optimised for the tripod and has restricted movement. For example although you can use it perfectly for head height photography etc, if you wanted to point your phone towards the sky for astrophotography, this is a challenge. However, if using a standard camera, you are able to do this as the mount works differently. This lead me to purchasing a separate phone holder for £5 which is actually quite good but it's a shame I had to make a separate purchase to properly use the tripod for what I wanted. It is also my fault for perhaps not looking into the tripod to see if this was a feature but I assumed it would be given the tripod comes with a bluetooth switch for the camera. Good price and it comes with a handy carrying bag.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The Concept B174A1 Lightweight Tripod for Phone offers a practical solution for those seeking a portable and versatile option for smartphone photography. Standing at 60 inches (152 cm), this tripod provides a convenient height for capturing various angles and scenes.One notable feature is its lightweight design, making it an excellent choice for on-the-go photographers or those who prioritize portability. The inclusion of a phone holder adds to its smartphone compatibility, allowing users to capture steady shots with ease.However, it's crucial to consider its limitations when used with heavier cameras. The tripod may not be suitable for supporting substantial weight, and users should exercise caution when attempting to use it with larger or heavier camera setups. For optimal stability, it's recommended to keep the legs open widely, especially when extending the height.The swivel pan head enhances the tripod's flexibility, enabling users to achieve diverse perspectives. Additionally, the inclusion of a Bluetooth remote adds convenience, allowing for remote triggering of shots, enhancing the overall user experience.In conclusion, the Concept B174A1 Lightweight Tripod for Phone is an ideal companion for smartphone photographers seeking a compact and travel-friendly solution. While it excels in portability and versatility for smartphones, users should be mindful of its weight limitations when considering it for heavier camera setups. Adjusting the legs for stability is key to maximizing its performance, especially when extending the height.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: good for a phone, not so good for a camera
reviews.reviewText: This tripod is a great option for beginners and casual photographers who are looking for an affordable and easy-to-use tripod. It's lightweight and compact, making it easy to carry around, and it's also very stable, even when fully extended. The tripod comes with a phone holder and a Bluetooth remote. The phone holder is adjustable and fits most smartphones. The Bluetooth remote is easy to use and allows me to take pictures from a distance. Generally, I am quite happy with this tripod but the quick-release plate is a bit flimsy and it's not great for cameras
